abstracts.cdata!:
The key objective of the Rural Finance
            Technical Assistance Project is to stimulate and support the
            creation of a savings and loan movement at the grass-roots
            level which can provide financial services on a sustainable
            basis to its members, and over time develop banking and
            borrowing relationships with formal institutions. The
            project includes:  (a) establishment of Savings and Loan
            Associations (SLAs) in which all forms of savings, including
            savings in kind, will be tested; (b) support for project
            management, monitoring and evaluation, by the Mutual Savings
            and Loan Development Association, which has been established
            as a non-government association; and (c) services to develop
            off-farm activities through basic and entrepreneurship
            training in rural areas.  The project will not provide any
            monies for SLA lending.
